item.title: Fortnite May Be Gearing Up For Fast & Furious Season
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-may-be-gearing-up-for-fast-furious-season/1100-6529442/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There have been some rumblings in the past couple weeks that Fortnite would be collaborating with the Fast & Furious movie franchise in the very near future--and those leaks took on a whole new meaning on Wednesday when we saw the very first teaser image for Chapter 6 Season 2, which showed a new version of Midas wearing Dominic Toretto's signature sleeveless black tee and gold chain--alongside a new season title, Lawless, and the launch date, February 21.

You can see it there just the left of the season title--Midas Toretto right there on a wanted poster. It's an image that puts an entirely new spin on some recent leaks that had seemed pretty run of the mill initially. Specifically, there were two leaks: that Dom's Dodge Charger would finally be ported from Rocket League to Fortnite, and that Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel) and Han Lue (Sung Kang) would be getting skins.

Since two Fast & Furious cars were just brought over from Rocket League in the fall, it wasn't that big a deal to learn that others would follow. Rocket League has released five different Fast & Furious cars over the years, and it only made sense to keep porting them. But the word that we'd be getting skins for Dom and Han made it clear that this stage of the Fast & Furious collab would be a bigger deal--it indicated that Han's Mazda RX-7, also in Rocket League, could arrive imminently as well, for one thing. But now we have to also wonder if we might be getting one of these new character skins in the battle pass.

This first official teaser, now, is only going to ramp up the speculation about whether this means that Chapter 6 Season 2 is an outright Fast & Furious season. It's an exciting prospect for those who enjoy Fortnite's car-based gameplay, but it might inspire fear in the folks who detested last summer's divisive Wrecked season. But since the cars in Fast & Furious are not usually weapon platforms, it's doubtful this car-based season would be quite as ridiculous as that one was.

Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 2 starts on Friday, February 21, and it's very gradually starting to come into focus as the big day inches closer and closer. We're tracking all the rumors and leaks about upcoming content in the new season right over here, so you don't have to.

Phil Owen on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: This $190 Elden Ring Nightreign Helmet Probably Won't Protect You, But At Least It Looks Cool
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/this-190-elden-ring-nightreign-helmet-probably-wont-protect-you-but-at-least-it-looks-cool/1100-6529441/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Elden Ring Nightreign has an official release date of May 30, and fans looking to splurge on the co-op game can check out a very cool piece of merchandise being released alongside the standard and deluxe versions. While there is a $200 collector's edition that comes with extra DLC, art books, and a statue, there's also the $190 Wylder Helmet replica that you can preorder through the Bandai Store.

This is described as a 1:1 scale replica of the hero's helmet, and it comes with everything you need to turn it into an attention-grabbing display piece in your home. Will it protect you from the Elden Lords, should they ever pierce the membrane separating our dimensions? Probably not, so you'll want to consider using it only for cosplay purposes. Bandai says only 9,999 of these will be made, and they'll be available starting May 30.

One thing to also note here is that you're not getting a copy of Elden Ring Nightreign with this replica, but it is a nice addition to your collection if you picked up any of the previously released Malenia and Messmer Elden Ring helmets that Bandai Namco sold for a limited time.

Elden Ring Nightreign is the latest entry in From Software's critically acclaimed souls-like franchise, following the release of Elden Ring in 2022 and its massive expansion Shadow of the Erdtree in 2024.

"Elden Ring Nightreign requires you to play a From Software game the wrong way. It asks players to prioritize aggression over stoicism; encourages almost reckless speed over careful strategy; and casts aside meticulous exploration for smash-and-grab expeditions," Tamoor Hussain wrote in GameSpot's Elden Ring Nightreign preview.

The game will launch for PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, and Xbox One in May, and an invite-only network test will kick off on February 14 and run through February 17.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Has A Secret Ending You Only See If You're The Worst Person Ever
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/kingdom-come-deliverance-2-has-a-secret-ending-you-only-see-if-youre-the-worst-person-ever/1100-6529439/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 lets players act however they want in a massive medieval open world, but like some of its fellow open-ended RPGs, certain actions have consequences. As it turns out, being an absolute menace to society at every chance you get unlocks a secret, morbid ending for protagonist Henry.

GamesRadar spotted an X/Twitter post from a player and YouTuber NikTekOfficial that shows what happens when you "commit multiple crimes" in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, and it doesn't end well. This is the final step in the game's crime-and-punishment scale, as it gets more dire each time you're caught--something that NikTek also covered.

Warning! Spoilers for Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 below.

Eventually, guards will capture Henry if he gets too out of hand, giving him the option to pay off his sins. There's also the more ballsy route to continue the chaos by fighting his way out of the predicament. If you want to try to pay it off, the amount set is always too high and Henry can only say he can't afford the price. From there, he's thrown in prison awaiting the hangman.

A nearly two-minute cutscene follows that has Henry getting jeered and spit on by a crowd as he's escorted to the gallows. As the standing stool is kicked from under him, the game over screen reads, "You have been executed for your crimes." What a way to go.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: One Piece Pirate Warriors 4 Is Hitting PS5 And Xbox Series X|S With Free Upgrade
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/one-piece-pirate-warriors-4-is-hitting-ps5-and-xbox-series-x-s-with-free-upgrade/1100-6529436/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Since 1997, One Piece's Monkey D. Luffy and his Straw Hat Pirates have sailed the high seas while searching for treasure. But now, Bandai Namco is bringing some treasure home with a modern-console upgrade for One Piece Pirate Warriors 4. Anyone who already owned the game for PS4 or Xbox One can get the PS5 or Xbox Series X|S update for free. That announcement was accompanied by the following video. which shows off some of the game's newly enhanced visuals.

As noted in the video above, One Piece Pirate Warriors has sold 4 million copies across all platforms since its launch in 2020. The game will also get standalone PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S releases for fans who didn't purchase it before. However, there was no release date included in the announcement.

In addition to the upgrade, Bandai Namco confirmed that more updates and DLC are in the works for Pirate Warriors 4 regardless of which platform its' on. Through the original release and subsequent DLC, Pirate Warriors 4 currently has a roster of 61 One Piece characters. That number will be going up, and fans are invited to vote for which characters they want to see in an upcoming DLC release. That survey can be found on Bandai Namco's site. There are 23 characters to choose from, but the voting period only extends through the end of February.

Bandai Namco also said that more information about the upcoming DLC will be released soon. In the meantime, One Piece's live-action series on Netflix recently unveiled most of its new cast additions for Season 2. Netflix hasn't set a date for that yet, but it seems likely to arrive in either late 2025 or in 2026.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Kingdom Come 2 Mods Are Coming, Get A First Peek With Henry Holding A Fish
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/kingdom-come-2-mods-are-coming-get-a-first-peek-with-henry-holding-a-fish/1100-6529434/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Warhorse Studios has announced that a big new feature is coming to Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2, as official modding support is headed to the medieval RPG on PC via Steamworks.

The developer said fans can "stay tuned" for more information on official modding support for the game, but for now, the studio teased, "Bohemia is about to get even more exciting."

The studio also released an image of Henry riding a horse, wielding a fish instead of a sword and riding a horse that looks more like a purple Zebra. This appears to be a taste of what's to come in terms of how fans will be able to modify the game to their liking with whatever they can dream up.

Kingdom Come 2's official modding support will seemingly be limited to PC, at least right away. Whether or not mod support comes to the console editions of the game remains to be seen.

Kingdom Come 2 launched earlier in February and had a massive debut on Steam; it also sold 1 million copies in its first 24 hours.

For more, check out GameSpot's glowing Kingdom Come: Deliverance II review. Additionally, we have a guides hub that offers information spanning from campaign length to quest chains.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Preorders Now Open
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/elden-ring-nightreign-preorder-guide/1100-6529431/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Elden Ring Nightreign is set to release on May 30, and preorders are now open ahead of its arrival. Unlike the base game and Shadow of the Erdtree expansion, this standalone installment is designed around quick, cooperative battles. You’ll pick from a list of eight different characters (each with their own abilities), before venturing out to survive three days as you explore the landscape for items and attempt to outrun the ever-shrinking circle of fire.

Our hands-on preview revealed a game that's shaping up to be a unique spin on the usual From Software formula, and fans of the series will be happy to hear there are several versions of the game up for preorder--including one that offers heaps of collectible goodies. Here's a closer look at Elden Ring Nightreign preorders, including all versions up for grabs and any available preorder bonuses.

Elden Ring Nightreign Preorder Bonus

Preorder Elden Ring Nightreign to get the in-game It’s Raining gesture. There’s also a retailer-exclusive bonus at Best Buy right now, which gets you a free $10 gift card with your purchase. We’ll update the article if any other retailer-exclusive preorder bonuses are announced ahead of May 30.

Elden Ring Nightreign Standard Edition

$40

This version of Elden Ring Nightreign includes the base game and any eligible preorder bonuses. Preorders are live at Best Buy and GameStop, as well as the usual digital storefronts for each platform.

Elden Ring Nightreign Deluxe Edition

$55

Step up to the Digital Deluxe Edition to get a few in-game goodies. Along with the base game and any eligible preorder bonuses, you’ll get the following:

  • Digital artbook
  • Mini soundtrack
  • Additional DLC (Extra playable characters and bosses)

Elden Ring Nightreign Collector’s Edition

$200

The Collector’s Edition of Elden Ring Nightreign is loaded with collectibles. Here’s a look at what your hefty $200 investment gets you:

  • Base game
  • Additional DLC (Extra playable characters and bosses)
  • Statue of Wylder (25cm tall)
  • Nightfarer cards (8 tarot cards)
  • Hardcover artbook (40 pages)
  • Steelbook
  • Digital soundtrack
  • Collector’s box

Wylder Character Helmet

$190

Another cool collectible is up for preorder in the form of the Wylder Character Helmet. This is a 1:1 scale, prop-quality replica, making it an excellent display piece or as an accessory for your next cosplay. While it looks stunning, note that this does not come with a copy of Elden Ring Nightreign--so be sure to snag one of the above preorders if you want to be playing on May 30.
